calibration_questions.question: Corporate whistleblowing protection - Should we protect whistleblowers who expose corporate wrongdoing?

perspective_for.quote: There are certain secrets that are so important to expose that you must be willing to risk your career, your freedom, even your life. When institutions become corrupt, the only way to preserve democracy is to let the truth see daylight, regardless of the personal cost.

perspective_against.quote: Order and stability require trust within institutions. When individuals take it upon themselves to violate oaths and confidences, they undermine the very foundations of civil society. Reform must come through proper channels, not through betrayal of sacred commitments.

calibration_questions.question: Gun control support - Should there be stricter gun control laws?
calibration_questions.option_a: Yes, stricter gun laws to reduce deaths

perspective_for.quote: We have a responsibility to protect our children and citizens from preventable violence. Other nations have proven that sensible firearm regulations save lives without eliminating freedom. The right to life must be balanced against the right to bear arms.

perspective_against.quote: The strongest reason for the people to retain the right to keep and bear arms is, as a last resort, to protect themselves against tyranny in government. When the government fears the people, there is liberty. When the people fear the government, there is tyranny.

calibration_questions.question: Path to citizenship for Dreamers - Should children brought illegally to the US be given a path to citizenship?
calibration_questions.option_a: No, they entered illegally and should be deported
calibration_questions.option_b: Yes, they deserve a path to citizenship

perspective_for.quote: Give me your tired, your poor, your huddled masses yearning to breathe free. These children know no other home. To punish them for their parents' choices is to abandon our founding ideals. Compassion toward the innocent is the measure of a civilization.

perspective_against.quote: The one absolutely certain way of bringing this nation to ruin would be to permit it to become a tangle of squabbling nationalities. We can have no divided allegiance here. We must insist upon undiluted Americanism. A nation that cannot control its borders will cease to be a nation.

calibration_questions.question: Cancel culture for old statements - Should people lose their careers over offensive statements made years ago?
calibration_questions.option_a: Yes, they must be held accountable

perspective_for.role: American writer and civil rights activist
perspective_for.quote: Not everything that is faced can be changed, but nothing can be changed until it is faced. Words have power—they reveal character. Those who harm with language must understand there are consequences. Accountability is not cruelty; it is how we build a more just world.

perspective_against.role: South African anti-apartheid revolutionary and president
perspective_against.quote: Resentment is like drinking poison and then hoping it will kill your enemies. I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. If I could forgive my jailers, surely we can allow others to grow beyond their past mistakes. Redemption must be possible.

calibration_questions.question: Classic trolley problem - A runaway trolley will kill 5 people. You can pull a lever to divert it, but it will kill 1 person instead. Do you pull the lever?
calibration_questions.option_b: No, don't pull the lever (let 5 die)

perspective_for.role: English philosopher, founder of modern utilitarianism
perspective_for.quote: It is the greatest happiness of the greatest number that is the measure of right and wrong. Five lives hold more happiness, more potential, more love than one. The calculus is clear: we must act to minimize suffering. Inaction when action could save more lives is itself a moral failure.

perspective_against.quote: One may never do evil so that good may result from it. To deliberately kill an innocent person, even to save others, is to treat human life as a means rather than an end. We are not the masters of life and death. Our hands must remain clean, even when the consequences break our hearts.

calibration_questions.question: Trolley with family member - Same scenario, but the 1 person is your daughter. Do you still pull the lever to save 5 strangers?
calibration_questions.option_a: Yes, pull the lever (save 5 strangers, sacrifice daughter)
calibration_questions.option_b: No, don't pull the lever (save daughter, let 5 die)

perspective_for.quote: What is not good for the swarm is not good for the bee. We are all part of the human family. To privilege one life—even one we love—over the many is to fail in our duty to humanity. The Stoic accepts this harsh truth: justice must be impartial, even when it tears the heart.

perspective_against.quote: Abraham's willingness to sacrifice Isaac was praised, yet the universal ethic condemns murder. This is the paradox: particular relationships transcend universal duty. A father who would not save his child for five strangers is not immoral—he is human. Love demands the impossible, and we must live with that tension.

calibration_questions.question: Lie to Nazis hiding refugees - Nazis ask if you're hiding Jewish refugees in your home. You are. Do you lie?

perspective_for.quote: When a madman is driving a car on the Kurfürstendamm, the ultimate question is not whether I tell him the truth about his direction, but whether I wrestle the steering wheel away from him. There are times when telling the truth is a betrayal of truth itself. When the state becomes criminal, conscience demands resistance.

perspective_against.quote: A lie always harms another; even if it helps one person, it harms humanity itself by making the source of truth unreliable. To lie to an authority, even a corrupt one, is to undermine the very possibility of trust and justice. You have no right to assume the consequences of your honesty will be worse than your deception.

calibration_questions.question: Report reformed criminal friend - Your friend confesses they committed a serious crime 10 years ago but have completely reformed. Do you report them?
calibration_questions.option_b: No, they've reformed and deserve peace

perspective_for.quote: I believe, when statesmen forsake their own private conscience for the sake of their public duties, they lead their country by a short route to chaos. The law is not a light for you or any man to see by; the law is not an instrument of any kind. The law is a causeway upon which the citizen may walk safely. We must not betray it, even for friendship.

perspective_against.quote: What is history? An echo of the past in the future; a reflex from the future on the past. Jean Valjean stole bread and was punished for life—until someone showed him mercy. True justice recognizes transformation. To condemn the redeemed is to deny the possibility of human goodness. Society must allow for second chances.

calibration_questions.question: Harsh truth vs kind lie - A terminally ill patient asks if they're going to die. Telling them will cause immense distress. Do you tell the truth?
calibration_questions.option_b: No, lie to spare them suffering

perspective_for.quote: The unexamined life is not worth living, and neither is a life built on comfortable lies. To deny someone the truth of their own mortality is to deny them their humanity, their agency, their right to prepare for death with dignity. Truth, however painful, is the foundation of wisdom and a life well-lived.

perspective_against.role: Swiss-American psychiatrist, pioneer in death studies
perspective_against.quote: Dying is something we human beings do continuously, not just at the end of our physical lives. Hope is not about cure; it's about comfort. Sometimes the kindest thing we can do is protect someone's remaining days from despair. Let them live in peace, not in terror of what's coming.

calibration_questions.question: Wealth redistribution - Should the government significantly increase taxes on the wealthy to fund social programs?
calibration_questions.option_b: No, people should keep what they earn

perspective_for.quote: The test of our progress is not whether we add more to the abundance of those who have much; it is whether we provide enough for those who have too little. No business which depends for existence on paying less than living wages has any right to continue. Wealth concentrated in few hands is a threat to democracy itself.

perspective_against.quote: The man who produces while others dispose of his product, is a slave. Wealth is not taken from the poor—it is created by the productive. To penalize achievement and reward need is to destroy the very engine of human progress. Each person has a moral right to exist for their own sake.

calibration_questions.question: Death penalty - Should the state have the right to execute convicted murderers?
calibration_questions.option_b: No, the state should never kill

perspective_for.role: Babylonian king, creator of legal code
perspective_for.quote: If a man put out the eye of another man, his eye shall be put out. If a builder builds a house that collapses and kills the owner, the builder shall be put to death. Justice requires proportionality. The most heinous crimes demand the ultimate penalty. This is not vengeance—it is balance.

perspective_against.quote: People are more than the worst thing they have ever done in their lives. The death penalty is a poor person's issue. It is about who has money and power and who doesn't. We cannot teach that killing is wrong by killing. When we execute, we become the very thing we condemn.

calibration_questions.question: Torture for information - A terrorist knows where a bomb is hidden that will kill thousands. Is torture justified to get the information?
calibration_questions.option_a: Yes, torture is justified to save lives

perspective_for.quote: When you have to kill a man, it costs nothing to be polite. But when the fate of civilization hangs in the balance, we must be willing to do what is necessary, however distasteful. The survival of democracy may require us to temporarily suspend its niceties. History will judge us by outcomes, not methods.

perspective_against.quote: I know from personal experience that the abuse of prisoners sometimes produces good intelligence, but often produces bad intelligence because under torture a person will say anything to make the pain stop. But more importantly, it serves as a great propaganda tool for those who recruit people to fight against us.

calibration_questions.question: Euthanasia - Should terminally ill people in unbearable pain have the right to end their own lives with medical assistance?
calibration_questions.option_a: Yes, they have the right to die with dignity
calibration_questions.option_b: No, life is sacred and should not be ended

perspective_for.quote: I am not 'committing suicide.' I am dying from cancer. My question is: Who has the right to tell me that I don't deserve this choice? That I deserve to suffer for weeks or months in tremendous amounts of physical and emotional pain? My life is mine to protect and defend. This is my choice.

perspective_against.quote: There is something beautiful in seeing the poor accept their lot, to suffer it like Christ's Passion. The world gains much from their suffering. We are all pencils in the hand of God. He writes through us, and however imperfect we are, He writes beautifully. Life is sacred until natural death.

calibration_questions.question: Absolute free speech - Should hate speech be legally protected as free expression?
calibration_questions.option_a: No, hate speech causes harm and should be banned
calibration_questions.option_b: Yes, all speech should be protected

perspective_for.quote: If we don't believe in freedom of expression for people we despise, we don't believe in it at all. The smart way to keep people passive is to limit the spectrum of acceptable opinion, but allow very lively debate within that spectrum. Censorship, even of hateful ideas, is the tool of tyrants.

perspective_against.quote: Unlimited tolerance must lead to the disappearance of tolerance. If we extend unlimited tolerance even to those who are intolerant, if we are not prepared to defend a tolerant society against the onslaught of the intolerant, then the tolerant will be destroyed, and tolerance with them. We must claim the right to suppress them if necessary.

calibration_questions.question: Climate action - Should governments implement aggressive climate policies even if they significantly harm economic growth?
calibration_questions.option_a: Yes, climate action must be the priority
calibration_questions.option_b: No, economic growth cannot be sacrificed

perspective_for.quote: You say you love your children above all else, and yet you are stealing their future. What is the point of economic growth if we have no planet to live on? We cannot solve a crisis without treating it as a crisis. Our house is on fire—I am here to say, our house is on fire.

perspective_against.quote: Climate change is real and man-made, but we need to be smart about solutions. Poverty kills more people than climate change ever will. Lifting billions out of poverty requires cheap energy now. We can address climate change through innovation and prosperity, not by making people poorer through economically destructive policies.

calibration_questions.question: Abortion rights - Should abortion be legally available to women who choose it?
calibration_questions.option_a: Yes, women have the right to choose

perspective_for.quote: The decision whether or not to bear a child is central to a woman's life, to her well-being and dignity. It is a decision she must make for herself. When government controls that decision, she is being treated as less than a fully adult human responsible for her own choices. Forced motherhood is forced labor.

perspective_against.quote: Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere. The Negro cannot win if he is willing to sacrifice the futures of his children for immediate personal comfort and safety. Life is God's gift. To deny the right to life is to deny the sacred. We must protect the most vulnerable among us—the unborn included.

calibration_questions.question: Universal healthcare - Should healthcare be guaranteed as a right to all citizens, paid for by taxes?
calibration_questions.option_a: Yes, healthcare is a human right

perspective_for.quote: I came to believe that health services ought not to have a price tag on them. No one should be denied access to medical care because of inability to pay. A civilized society ensures that all citizens can see a doctor when they're sick, regardless of their bank account.

perspective_against.quote: A society that puts equality before freedom will get neither. A society that puts freedom before equality will get a high degree of both. Government healthcare creates inefficiency, rationing, and reduces the incentive for innovation. The free market, with all its imperfections, produces better outcomes than bureaucracy ever could.
